Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MancalaModel

    public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements MancalaModel
    Fully working implementation of a model for mancala that implements MancalModel
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Enrique Padilla (formatting done by Maxim Tiourin)

      • selectPit

        public void selectPit(int pit)
        Description copied from interface: MancalaModel
        Tells the model that the player has selected the given pit for their turn. The user interface will only allow the clicking of pits for the current player who's turn it is, so this does not need to be checked for validity, unless desired.
        Assumes that pits id's will be stored in a indexed manner that can be trivially checked, EXAMPLE: such as pits[0] = Model.PIT_LEFTMANCALA, pits[1] = MODEL.PIT_BOTTOM01, or some similar implementation such as this. Buttons for the pits will be indexed in such a way, so it will help to have similar architecture in the model. *
        Specified by:
        selectPit in interface MancalaModel
        Parameters:
        pit - the id of the pit that was selected.

      • isMancalaPit

        public boolean isMancalaPit(int pit)
        Description copied from interface: MancalaModel
        Returns true if the given pit is a mancala pit, and false if it is a normal pit.
        Specified by:
        isMancalaPit in interface MancalaModel
        Parameters:
        pit - the pit to check
        Returns:
        boolean true if the pit is a mancala pit

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Description copied from interface: MancalaModel
        When this is ran the game is started over using the current settings in the model. This will be called by the controller.
        Specified by:

      • hasGameEnded

        public int hasGameEnded()
        Description copied from interface: MancalaModel
        If the game is over and one of the player's has won, returns the index of the winning player. Otherwise returns -1 to represent game still going on.
        Specified by:
        hasGameEnded in interface MancalaModel
        Returns:
        int index of winning player
